Ernakulam



Fort Kochi


Fort Kochi stands as a charming enclave seamlessly weaving the echoes of colonial history with the vibrant hues of contemporary life. Wander through its narrow streets adorned with colonial buildings, art galleries, and quirky cafes, immersing yourself in the cultural tapestry shaped by Portuguese, Dutch, and British influences. Known for vibrant street art, iconic Chinese fishing nets along the shore, and the historic Paradesi Synagogue, Fort Kochi captivates history enthusiasts and art lovers alike. The fusion of historical charm and modern vibrancy creates a unique atmosphere, making Fort Kochi a must-visit destination for those seeking a delightful blend of the past and present.

Marine Drive

Embracing the Arabian Sea shoreline, Marine Drive in Kochi is a scenic promenade offering breathtaking views of the water and cityscape. This popular spot is cherished by locals and tourists for leisurely walks, sunset gazing, and enjoying the cool sea breeze. Lined with shopping centers, eateries, and recreational spaces, Marine Drive symbolizes the city's modernity and natural beauty, creating a welcoming atmosphere for those seeking a tranquil escape by the sea.


Veegaland (Wonderla Amusement Park)



Veegaland, known as Wonderla Amusement Park, emerges as an exhilarating destination for adventure and family fun near Kochi. Its diverse attractions include adrenaline-pumping rides, refreshing water attractions, and engaging family-friendly entertainment, promising an exciting day out for visitors of all ages. Wonderla's modern amenities, well-designed themed zones, and a wide variety of rides contribute to its popularity among those seeking both thrills and joy in Ernakulam. From the twists and turns of thrilling roller coasters to the refreshing splash of water rides, Wonderla offers a perfect blend of excitement and family-friendly enjoyment, ensuring a memorable and immersive experience for all who explore this lively amusement park nestled in the heart of Kerala.
